Preview: Two companies — Duke Energy and a French company — have won leases for offshore wind farms off North Carolina with bids totaling $315 million.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: As sea level rise accelerates, Carolinas' coast is at risk | WFAE 90.7 ...
Preview: A new report by federal climate scientists says sea level rise is accelerating, posing a more immediate threat to coastal areas of the Carolinas and nationwide than previously thought.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Colonial Pipeline raises estimate of Huntersville gasoline spill ...
Preview: Colonial Pipeline has raised its estimate again for how much gasoline spilled at a Huntersville nature preserve two years ago. And the company said in a web post Friday that the record-breaking spill probably happened weeks before it was discovered.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: With 'Taps,' salutes and speeches, NC remembers the fallen | WFAE ...
Preview: Memorial Day observances around North Carolina Monday remembered American service members who have died in conflict. They included wreath-layings, a 110-mile memorial motorcycle ride and a planting of flags at Salisbury National Cemetery.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy is temporarily without a headquarters, as workers ...
Preview: Duke Energy is officially without a corporate headquarters - at least for now. The company says all its employees have now moved out of the uptown Charlotte office tower that has been known as Duke Energy Center.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: North Carolina starts the process of drafting a plan to cut carbon in ...
Preview: State regulators have laid out the schedule for a yearlong process that's supposed to close coal-fired power plants and transform the electricity business in the Carolinas to address climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: European lawmakers battle over whether to limit wood for energy ...
Preview: A European Parliament effort to roll back policies and subsidies that encourage burning wood pellets for energy has suffered a potential setback.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte transportation plan has a big goal: getting us out of our ...
Preview: Charlotte officials are seeking comments online and at public meetings on a new transportation policy that among other things aims to reduce one-person car trips to half of all transportation trips by 2040.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Mecklenburg eyes changes to boost recycling, fight climate change ...
Preview: Deliveries to Mecklenburg County's recycling sorting center are expected to decline this year for at least the fourth year in a row. County officials and recycling advocates are pushing for improvements, to solve not just our waste problem but also to fight climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Federal auction will sell leases for ocean wind farms off Wilmington ...
Preview: The federal government will auction leases Wednesday for two potential wind farms in the Atlantic Ocean off Wilmington. Someday they could power a half-million homes, but there's still years of work before that happens.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Storms and coal ash costs hit Duke Energy's profits, but the NC ...
Preview: Charlotte-based Duke Energy's profits declined in the first three months of the year, but revenues were up as the company saw a continued rebound from the coronavirus pandemic.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Rising seas, salt water threaten coastal farms, so farmers adapt ...
Preview: Rising sea levels, salt water intrusion and more intense storms due to climate change are forcing farmers in eastern North Carolina to fight back and even take some fields out of production. WFAE climate reporter David Boraks and Climate Central's John Upton visited Hyde County on the Pamlico Sound and have this report.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: We keep rebuilding our beaches, but what are the long-term costs ...
Preview: Spring is high season for beach replenishment projects along the Carolinas coast. They're popular with waterfront property owners and communities that rely on beach tourism. But they're also increasingly expensive. And coastal scientists say they make no sense environmentally, especially as sea levels rise.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Colonial agrees to nearly $5M in penalties for Huntersville gas spill ...
Preview: Colonial Pipeline has agreed to pay the state of North Carolina nearly $5 million in penalties and to provide additional data and cleanup plans for a massive gasoline spill in Huntersville two years ago.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Q&A: NC regulators listen as they draft a plan to cut CO2 emissions ...
Preview: Public hearings in Asheville and Charlotte this week will give people a chance to comment on how North Carolina should reduce carbon emissions from power plants to fight climate change. Governor Roy Cooper and the legislature agree on the goals, but there's a big fight over the details. WFAE climate reporter David Boraks talks with host Marshall Terry.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Electric buses on Charlotte streets and other climate progress ...
Preview: There's still a long way to go before the city of Charlotte meets its climate goals. City staff reported signs of progress this week, such as the debut of electric buses on city streets. But they also said the city may need to buy carbon offsets to hit its target of eliminating fossil fuel emissions in its buildings and vehicles.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Boone, NC, hits a goal many seek: 100% renewable energy in town ...
Preview: As local governments across the country puzzle over how to eliminate their use of electricity generated by fossil fuels, the North Carolina town of Boone has met that goal.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy solar rebates go fast; you have 1 more chance in July ...
Preview: The latest round of applications for Duke Energy solar rebates in January was as competitive as ever and most customers came away empty handed — again. There's one more application period in July before the five-year program ends.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: North Carolina's biggest greenhouse gas challenge is transportation ...
Preview: Transportation has overtaken electricity generation as the largest source of greenhouse gas emissions in North Carolina. That's according to an updated greenhouse gas inventory published this week by state environmental regulators.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte leaders call for transit funding, but vote on sales tax still ...
Preview: Transit advocates and city leaders are calling for approval of a proposed 1-cent sales tax for buses and transit in Mecklenburg County, even though it's still not clear when it might go to voters.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC attorney general wants a delay in Duke Energy's proposed ...
Preview: North Carolina's attorney general wants state regulators to delay approval of Duke Energy's proposed overhaul of rooftop solar rules and incentives.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: At Duke Energy annual meeting, a debate over solar rules changes ...
Preview: Duke Energy's proposal to change how rooftop solar owners in North Carolina are paid was an issue both inside and outside the company's annual meeting Thursday.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Europe may decide to limit the use of U.S. trees for energy. Here's ...
Preview: The European Union is considering changes to its climate policies that could have a big effect on a controversial segment of North Carolina's forestry sector — the wood pellet industry.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: 3 months after ceremony, Outer Banks bridge still isn't open | WUNC
Preview: A new bridge that shifts the main road on North Carolina's Outer Banks off a frequently-flooded section of Hatteras Island still isn't open, three months after officials held a grand opening. State transportation officials blame the holdup on poor quality pavement markings.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: U.S. and states agree to collaborate to build an offshore wind ...
Preview: The Biden administration announced a partnership Thursday with a bipartisan group of East Coast governors, including North Carolina's Roy Cooper, to help meet state and federal goals for expanding offshore wind energy and fighting climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: With Gaston mine approvals slow, Piedmont Lithium lines up foreign ...
Preview: Piedmont Lithium will begin mining next year, but not at its controversial proposed mine in northern Gaston County. Instead the company has lined up mines outside the country.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gov. Cooper orders update to rules for state buildings in flood areas ...
Preview: North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper has ordered an update of construction rules for state-owned buildings that takes into account the effects of sea level rise and climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: At a North Carolina energy conference, there are calls for climate ...
Preview: Policymakers along with business and nonprofit leaders are in Raleigh this week for a conference on North Carolina's transition to clean energy. While technology and policy are key themes, some speakers want to make sure people of color and low-income residents are not left out.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Local governments are shifting to EVs - if they can get them | WFAE ...
Preview: Cities and towns across the country have set ambitious goals to deal with climate change. Since transportation is the top source of greenhouse gas emissions that cause global warming, electrifying their vehicle fleets is an important strategy.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Could North Carolina be a hub for offshore wind development? Gov ...
Preview: North Carolina officials led by Gov. Roy Cooper are at an offshore wind conference in Atlantic City, New Jersey, this week promoting the state as a base for offshore wind development.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Global temperature was 6th warmest in 2021, continuing a climate ...
Preview: Federal climate scientists say the global average temperature continued an upward trend in 2021, adding fresh data for arguments that humans need to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. WFAE's climate reporter David Boraks talked with North Carolina and national experts.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: With new electric vehicle charger in west Charlotte, officials strive to ...
Preview: Gov. Roy Cooper and Charlotte Mayor Vi Lyles joined a ceremony on Charlotte's west side Thursday to dedicate a new electric vehicle charging station. It was a lot of fanfare for a small project that the two leaders say will help meet climate and racial equity goals.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy plans would cut CO2 and add renewables — but at a ...
Preview: Duke Energy filed plans with North Carolina regulators Monday for reducing and eventually eliminating carbon emissions from its power plants to meet state climate goals. The Charlotte-based utility offered four scenarios that would eliminate coal fired power plants and add new gas, nuclear and renewable energy.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Auction winners sign NC offshore wind leases just ahead of ban ...
Preview: The two companies that won a federal auction to build wind farms off North Carolina have finalized leases, just before the start of 10-year federal moratorium ordered by the Trump administration.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Davidson rally shows support for Ukraine after 'this awful invasion ...
Preview: Several hundred people gathered on the Davidson Village Green on Sunday night for a rally in support of Ukraine, organized by residents with ties to the country. People wearing yellow and blue, some wrapped in Ukrainian flags, listened to speeches and reflected on the tragedy of the war.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC regulators begin hearings on Duke Energy carbon reduction ...
Preview: North Carolina utility regulators will hold public hearings around the state beginning this week on Duke Energy's proposed plan for cutting carbon emissions from energy generation.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Across the Carolinas, December was warmer and drier than normal ...
Preview: All those 70-plus degree days during the holidays added up to a December that was significantly warmer and drier than normal across the Carolinas. Experts say it's a sign of both short- and long-term climate trends.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gov. Roy Cooper order boosts NC's climate goals and targets ...
Preview: A new executive order from Governor Roy Cooper sets more ambitious goals for fighting climate change across the state and calls for new efforts to limit environmental injustice.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Davidson asbestos mill project inches forward; no start date yet ...
Preview: Plans to redevelop a former cotton and asbestos mill in downtown Davidson are inching forward after the project hit two key milestones.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Judge approves nearly $5M penalty over gasoline spill | WFAE 90.7 ...
Preview: A Mecklenburg County judge has approved Colonial Pipeline's agreement with state regulators that includes nearly $5 million in penalties for a massive gasoline spill in Huntersville two years ago.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy to offer regulators options on carbon reduction | WFAE ...
Preview: Duke Energy will present North Carolina utility regulators with a plan Monday for shifting away from fossil fuels. Actually, it's expected to be not just a single plan, but several plans.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: An Outer Banks boating channel is impassable because of sand ...
Preview: The U.S. Coast Guard and Army Corps of Engineers are working to open a new boating channel at Oregon Inlet at North Carolina's Outer Banks because of sand on the existing route.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: In Greensboro, Biden touts return of jobs to U.S. and pledges action ...
Preview: President Joe Biden was in Greensboro Thursday to talk up his administration's efforts to rebuild the economy and address racial inequality.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Appeal to halt Outer Banks bridge cites lack of need, rising seas ...
Preview: Environmental and citizens groups have filed a federal court appeal in hopes of stopping a half-billion-dollar bridge proposed at North Carolina's Outer Banks. And they're citing sea level rise as an argument.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: A study says a lithium mine would boost Gaston County's economy ...
Preview: Piedmont Lithium says its proposed mine and processing operation in northern Gaston County will create more than 1,000 jobs and generate $3.9 billion in economic activity in its first six years. But those predictions got a cool reception Tuesday from county commissioners and residents.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Be prepared: Atlantic could see 3 to 6 major hurricanes this year ...
Preview: Federal forecasters are predicting the seventh straight above-normal Atlantic hurricane season and urging preparedness to avoid a repeat of disasters like Hurricane Ida, which lashed Louisiana and produced tornadoes and floods in the northeast last year.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: As Charlotte pursues climate goals, some worry they're unreachable ...
Preview: Three years ago, the Charlotte City Council adopted goals to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and address climate change. WFAE's David Boraks reports on progress and concerns that the city won't meet its goals.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: North Carolina DEQ grants air quality permit to Sampson County ...
Preview: State environmental regulators have approved an air quality permit for a wood pellet plant in Sampson County. The permit was granted despite concerns by environmental and social justice groups.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Catawba commissioners cite reasons for rejecting solar farm | WUNC
Preview: Catawba County Commissioners say a proposed solar farm that would have supplied electricity to Wells Fargo was rejected this spring because it doesn't fit the county's vision for the site.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Winter in the Carolinas was warmer than normal, driven by climate ...
Preview: Forecasters last fall predicted a warmer, drier winter for the Carolinas, and that's what we got. It's a trend dating from at least the 1970s. In fact, federal weather data show that winters are warming faster than any other season across the region.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Huntersville gas spill total rises again; size remains a mystery ...
Preview: Colonial Pipeline says it's still recovering gasoline daily from a massive spill nearly 18 months ago in Huntersville, and still has no estimate of how much might be left.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Kings Mountain lithium mine could reopen to supply battery makers ...
Preview: Charlotte-based Albemarle Corp. is considering reopening an old lithium mine near Kings Mountain to supply electric vehicle battery makers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: As NC's governor calls for a redistricting commission, candidates ...
Preview: North Carolina candidates have been welcomed back into election offices to file for this year’s races following a delay that lasted over two months. But in Charlotte, Gov. Roy Cooper said the state needs an independent way to draw political districts.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Europe considers rules changes that would limit US pellet industry ...
Preview: The European Parliament is taking steps to reverse climate policies that promote the use of wood pellets to replace coal in power plants. That would put the brakes on a controversial industry that's booming in the Southeast.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: The way North Carolina's electricity rates are set will change with a ...
Preview: The way North Carolina's big electric companies set rates is changing in a big way. State regulators adopted rules last week to carry out a new law that among other things lets utilities seek multi-year rate plans and earn performance-based bonuses.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Groups criticize Duke Energy carbon plan for reliance on gas | WUNC
Preview: Businesses, consumers and environmental groups are criticizing Duke Energy's proposed plan to reduce carbon from energy generation in North Carolina.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: CATS puts electric buses on the road, plots how to convert fleet ...
Preview: Charlotte Area Transit System now has most of its 18 new electric buses on city roads as part of an 18-month trial. The head of CATS says he'll outline plans next week for replacing the entire fleet.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: 3 months after ceremony, Outer Banks bridge still isn't open | WUNC
Preview: A new bridge that shifts the main road on North Carolina's Outer Banks off a frequently-flooded section of Hatteras Island still isn't open, three months after officials held a grand opening. State transportation officials blame the holdup on poor quality pavement markings.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: South Carolina textile dyeing plant added to EPA Superfund priority ...
Preview: The EPA says a former textile dyeing plant in South Carolina is among a dozen hazardous waste sites nationwide that have been added to the Superfund National Priorities List.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Is it time to consider a new normal for winter in the Carolinas ...
Preview: December's un-wintry weather across the Southeast brought lots of unusual scenes: Crowds packing parks and beer gardens, people wearing short sleeves to Christmas parades, and azaleas blooming just before the holidays. Are the month's above-average temperatures a sign we need to reconsider what a normal winter looks like in the Carolinas?
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC businesses ride the e-cycle wave. Is this your next vehicle ...
Preview: Bicycle sales have surged during the coronavirus pandemic as more of us take to the roads and greenways for recreation - or give up our cars. Electric bikes and e-cycles are the market's fastest-growing segment.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Davidson startup has a solution to single-use plastic water bottles ...
Preview: Around the world, a million plastic bottles are bought every minute, according to the UN Environment Program. A Davidson startup company says it has a solution: bottled water that comes in refillable aluminum or glass containers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Solar installers say Duke Energy plan would hurt rooftop business ...
Preview: A group of North Carolina solar installers is challenging Duke Energy's proposal to change the way rooftop solar owners are paid for electricity. They say it would hurt business and hamper the state's climate change efforts.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC and Duke Energy slipping in Southeast regional solar ranking ...
Preview: North Carolina has long been a leader in solar energy. A new report says the state and its largest utility, Duke Energy, are continuing to slip in the rankings for solar energy capacity in the Southeast and nationally.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: With 2 new solar projects, Duke Energy will sell electricity to itself ...
Preview: Two new North Carolina solar farms owned by a subsidiary of Duke Energy have begun generating electricity. And for the first time, they're selling it to the company's regulated consumer side.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Adapt: Changing Climate in the Carolinas | WFAE 90.7 - Charlotte's ...
Preview: WFAE climate reporter David Boraks hosts this one-hour special report that examines how climate change affects the Carolinas and how we're responding. We hear from scientists, farmers, policymakers and other experts, as well as from activists concerned with the inequities of climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Will NC meet climate goals? 'We don't have a choice,' says DEQ ...
Preview: North Carolina's top environmental regulator says the state must keep making progress toward climate goals set four years ago and updated this year. In an interview, Elizabeth Biser also talked about federal funding coming to N.C. and about holding Colonial Pipeline accountable for the massive gasoline in Huntersville two years ago.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Could a distributed power network guard against threats to the grid ...
Preview: The U.S. power system is centralized. We rely on large, mostly fossil-fuel-burning plants to generate electricity. It's sent out on high-voltage wires over long distances (the grid). Substations step it down to lower voltages to power your home or business. An attack, a storm or other disruption can affect the wider network. But what if there was another way — a more decentralized solution?
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Dangerous heat days will multiply over the next 30 years, report ...
Preview: A new report says the number of dangerously hot days will multiply across the U.S. over the next 30 years due to global warming, even in normally cooler areas like the North Carolina mountains.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Moore County attack shows U.S. electric grid's Achilles' heel | WFAE ...
Preview: Authorities say it's still too early to say who fired gunshots into a pair of Duke Energy substations in central North Carolina, or why. But experts say the attack is a warning sign of the electric grid's vulnerability to people with bad intentions.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Battery component maker plans $3.5B campus near Charleston ...
Preview: Redwood Materials, a Nevada company that makes electric vehicle battery components, says it will build a $3.5 billion campus near Charleston, South Carolina. State officials say it's the largest economic development investment in South Carolina's history.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: North Carolina governor says electric trucks are key to cutting ...
Preview: The electric vehicle industry is growing across the U.S. and in North Carolina, mainly as sales of electric passenger vehicles speed up. But what about bigger vehicles? Gov. Roy Cooper said this week state officials are drafting new rules that could get more electric medium- and heavy-duty trucks and buses on state roads.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: How should NC shift to electric trucks? DEQ wants to know | WFAE ...
Preview: Public meetings are planned around the state in the coming weeks to help state environmental officials draft rules to promote a shift to electric trucks.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte's solar challenges follow similar projects' rising costs ...
Preview: A solar farm project that was supposed to help the city of Charlotte meet its climate goals is now uncertain after developers said they need a 25% price increase to keep it financially viable. It's one of many nationwide stalled by economic and social headwinds.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy Progress rates rise 9.9% because of higher fuel costs ...
Preview: Electricity rates will rise 9.9% on Thursday for Duke Energy Progress customers in Asheville, Raleigh and eastern North Carolina, because of higher costs for natural gas.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Piedmont Lithium picks east Tennessee for lithium plant | WFAE ...
Preview: Piedmont Lithium has picked a site in eastern Tennessee for a $600 million lithium processing plant. The Belmont-based company says it believes the plant will be the largest in the U.S. when it opens in 2025.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: After unwrapping gifts, take that white foam to the recycling center ...
Preview: The holiday season brings lots of foam packing into our homes and it usually gets tossed in the trash. This year, Mecklenburg County will recycle that foam for you.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC energy regulators face a choice with Duke carbon-cutting plan ...
Preview: State regulators face a year-end deadline to decide how Duke Energy will eliminate carbon emissions at power plants to meet the state's climate goals. After a year of debate, the North Carolina Utilities Commission is expected to issue an order next week.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Solar installer's failure is a red flag for buyers; how to avoid scams ...
Preview: Rooftop solar power has become something of a frontier land rush as we shift to renewable energy to fight climate change. Hundreds of entrepreneurs, some with little or no experience, have flooded into the business. The recent collapse of a Mooresville-based installer is a warning to buyers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Few answers in Moore County more than a week after substation ...
Preview: Ten days after two electrical substations in central North Carolina were knocked out by gunfire, there are still more questions than answers about the incident. The outage left about 45,000 customers without power, some for as long as five days
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte plans electric vehicle sharing service at affordable housing ...
Preview: Think of it as Zipcar for electric vehicles in underserved neighborhoods: In some Charlotte affordable housing complexes next year you'll be able to reserve and drive EVs as part of a federally backed car-sharing pilot program.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Groups say Duke Energy carbon plan limits their climate efforts ...
Preview: Businesses and local governments across North Carolina have set goals for reducing their reliance on fossil fuels. But they say those climate goals could be out of reach unless state regulators require changes in Duke Energy's plan for cutting carbon emissions from energy generation.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Regulators get few answers from Duke about substation attacks ...
Preview: Duke Energy officials faced questions from state utility regulators in Raleigh on Monday about the Dec. 3 attack on two electrical substations in Moore County. Three Duke executives offered few new details and still aren't saying publicly what the attack might cost customers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gaston mine would supply needed lithium, but neighbors fight it ...
Preview: There's a race on to mine lithium in the U.S. for electric vehicle batteries. It's part of the fight to slow global warming — and to some people a matter of national security. But to neighbors, a proposed mine in Gaston County is an impending environmental disaster.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: A proposed lithium mine presents a climate versus environment ...
Preview: The U.S. wants to mine lithium for electric vehicle batteries to meet climate change goals. But residents near a proposed open-pit mine object.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Appeals court upholds dismissal of suit over Confederate plates ...
Preview: A federal appeals court has upheld the dismissal of a lawsuit over North Carolina's decision to stop issuing specialty license plates with the Confederate battle flag.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Will NC join California in cutting payments to rooftop solar owners ...
Preview: California utility regulators last week adopted new rules sought by utility companies that reduce what rooftop solar owners get paid for electricity they send back to the grid. Will North Carolina be next?
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Climate activists chain themselves to entries at Charlotte private jet ...
Preview: Several climate protesters chained themselves to a door and a gate Thursday morning at the private jet terminal at Charlotte Douglas International Airport.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Expert witness hearing starts Tuesday on Duke Energy's carbon ...
Preview: Since filing its plans, Duke has faced a barrage of criticism from local government leaders, businesses, environmental groups and the attorney general's office.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Amid climate change, Duke Energy spends millions on the power ...
Preview: Climate change is already quietly costing us millions of dollars, as we try to prepare for extreme weather. In the Columbus County seat of Whiteville on Monday, Duke Energy celebrated the opening of a new electrical substation, part of $30 million in upgrades by Duke to ensure the power grid can withstand the next big hurricane.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Buyers plan apartments, shops at two former Duke Energy buildings ...
Preview: Duke Energy completed the sale of two properties in uptown Charlotte last week as it prepares to consolidate office space at its new headquarters tower on South Tryon Street. Redevelopment plans for the two buildings include apartments, shops and offices.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy and its critics battle over its 'clean energy transition ...
Preview: Federal and state officials are pushing electricity producers to shift away from fossil fuels to fight climate change. Here in North Carolina, state regulators are drafting a plan this fall to do that. Duke Energy is promoting its vision for a gradual "clean energy transition." At the same time, business and environmental groups are calling for a faster and cheaper shift.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Encore: Some residents are concerned about domestic lithium ...
Preview: The U.S. wants to mine more domestic lithium for electric vehicle batteries. It would require demolishing houses, digging up farms and disrupting streams. Some residents worry about the impact.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Home buyers should be told about past flood damage, groups say ...
Preview: Home sellers in North Carolina have to tell buyers if their properties are in a flood zone, but they don't have to say if homes have been damaged by flooding. As climate change brings more intense storms, environmental groups want to change that.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Changing Climate in the Carolinas | WFAE 90.7 - Charlotte's NPR ...
Preview: WFAE climate reporter David Boraks looks at how climate change is affecting us in the Carolinas, and how we're responding.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: As the climate warms, we can't overlook threat of nighttime heat ...
Preview: Climate change has increased the number of hot days nationwide and increased the likelihood of unhealthy extreme heat. As we look for ways to cope, we usually focus on daytime heat. But researchers at Duke University say not enough attention is paid to higher temperatures overnight.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC governor's order calls for a faster shift to electric trucks and ...
Preview: Gov. Roy Cooper issued another climate-related executive order Tuesday, this time pushing to increase the sale of electric trucks and buses in North Carolina. The governor said it would help the state meet its climate goals and create jobs.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: AG Josh Stein says regulators should not adopt Duke Energy's ...
Preview: NC Attorney General Josh Stein says state regulators should reject Duke Energy's proposals for reducing carbon from energy generation and instead, adopt a plan that meets the state's clean energy goals and costs less.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC experts don't see much progress at U.N. climate talks | WFAE ...
Preview: The United Nations climate summit in Egypt closed last weekend with an agreement to create a fund for developing nations dealing with the effects of climate change caused mainly by carbon emissions in rich nations. But there was no movement on efforts to cut heat-trapping pollution that causes global warming — and North Carolina climate experts said this week there's lots more to be done.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Instant study links Hurricane Ian's heavier rains to climate change ...
Preview: As Hurricane Ian barrels through the Carolinas, it's a safe bet that climate change has something to do with its intensity.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Officials tour Gastonia flood project, announce federal grants | WFAE ...
Preview: Federal officials and Gov. Roy Cooper toured a federally-funded flood control project in Gastonia Friday to promote two programs that help communities nationwide deal with the effects of climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy wants to pilot using F-150 batteries to supply the grid ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked state regulators to approve a test that would allow the utility to draw energy from electric vehicle batteries to the power grid during times of peak demand.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy seeks a 16% rate hike for eastern NC and Asheville ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked North Carolina regulators to approve rate increases totaling 16% over three years for customers of its Duke Energy Progress unit, in eastern North Carolina and the Asheville area. Duke says the extra money would pay to strengthen the electric grid, improve reliability and prepare for more renewable energy.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy names Bowman to replace De May as North Carolina ...
Preview: Duke Energy has named Kendal Bowman as president of its North Carolina operations. Bowman takes over on Jan. 1 from state President Stephen De May, who is retiring after 33 years.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Repairs complete on Moore County substations, power restored ...
Preview: Duke Energy on Wednesday finished repairing and testing two electrical substations in Moore County that were damaged by gunfire Saturday. The attacks cut power to about 45,000 customers initially.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Moore County attack spurs U.S. regulators to order study of electric ...
Preview: Federal energy regulators on Thursday ordered a study to determine if security standards need to be improved following recent attacks on electrical facilities, including one in North Carolina.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Preview: Advocates for changing the way electricity is managed and delivered in North Carolina are hoping that a bill filed in the state House of Representatives last week will give a boost to the idea. But don't hold your breath: The state's big utility, Duke Energy, opposes it and has a lot of influence at the General Assembly.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: State wants to improve energy efficiency, but builders object | WUNC
Preview: The North Carolina Building Code Council is considering tightening energy efficiency requirements for new homes and offices that could cut energy costs and help slow climate change. But at a public hearing Tuesday, home builders fought the idea.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Changing climate brings new concerns about NC's big hog and ...
Preview: Two human-driven trends are coming together to create new environmental worries in North Carolina. The first is the growing number of big hog and poultry farms, known as "concentrated animal feeding operations," or CAFOs. The other is climate change, which brings rising sea levels and more intense storms and flooding.Together, they're a recipe for trouble, according to a recent study by the Environmental Working Group.
Key.Author: David Boraks

The energy sector is the second-largest source of the heat-trapping pollution that causes global warming. As we close coal-fired plants, and eventually get rid of gas-fired power plants, too, the question is what will replace them.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Natural resources grants help NC communities deal with flooding ...
Preview: Recent grants from the state Department of Natural and Cultural Resources will help communities increase their resilience against climate threats. Gov. Roy Cooper's budget out this week seeks even more money for the program in the coming year.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Three killed in Dilworth construction site scaffolding collapse | WFAE ...
Preview: The Charlotte Fire Department said Monday that three people were killed when scaffolding collapsed at a Dilworth construction site.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte City Council to vote on lithium center incentives, solar farm ...
Preview: The City Council will hold a public hearing and vote Monday night on Charlotte's $7.2 million share of financial incentives for a proposed lithium research center in northeast Charlotte. The council also will vote on whether to accept a cost increase in electricity from a planned solar farm in Iredell County.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NCDEQ wants to adopt electric truck and bus rules by year's end ...
Preview: North Carolina environmental officials are facing lots of questions as they push to adopt rules by year's end that would speed sales of electric trucks and buses.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy's solar rebates end with a final lottery and waiting list ...
Preview: Duke Energy has awarded the final rebates in a five-year, $62 million program to boost rooftop solar installations in North Carolina. The program was required by a 2017 state law and was supposed to end last summer. But about $1.3 million was left over, so Duke held a final lottery this month.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Grammy winner Rhiannon Giddens celebrates North Carolina music ...
Preview: Grammy Award-winning musician and composer Rhiannon Giddens received an honorary doctor of fine arts degree from Davidson College this week and then took the stage to perform a set of original and traditional North Carolina tunes on banjo and fiddle.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: SC eyes electricity market changes that could save customers ...
Preview: A report on possible changes in the structure of South Carolina's electricity market is getting attention here, north of the border, because any changes there could have a big impact.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: North Carolina hopes to adopt electric truck rules by year's end ...
Preview: The rules would apply to any truck over 6,001 pounds — basically, pickups up to tractor-trailers. Sales targets would vary by size, between seven classes, with the goal of eventually 40%-75% of trucks sold in the state being zero-emission vehicles.

Preview: Just two months after North Carolina regulators signed off on Duke Energy's long-range plan for reducing carbon emissions, the company on Wednesday kicked off planning for a new version.

Article.Title: NC study maps out shift to electric cars, appliances, factories | WUNC
Preview: North Carolina will need more electric vehicles on the road, cleaner energy sources and a faster shift away from fossil fuels in all parts of the economy to meet its climate goals, according to a new report from Gov. Roy Cooper's office.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Legislators want to block rules for more energy efficient homes until ...
Preview: There's a battle in Raleigh over energy efficiency standards and building codes that has implications for both North Carolina's climate change efforts and the short- and long-term costs of homeownership.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Work group puzzles over how to deal with NC beach houses at risk ...
Preview: Coastal experts say North Carolina lacks the money and laws it needs to deal with hundreds of beachfront houses at risk of collapsing into the Atlantic Ocean because of sea level rise and erosion. A new state task force is looking for solutions.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy proposes two new programs to help customers use ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked North Carolina regulators to approve the expansion of a program that lets large customers contract for renewable energy. The Charlotte-based utility company also wants to offer renewable energy credits to customers who want to support the shift to clean energy to fight climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gaston County lithium mine gets another extension for state permit ...
Preview: North Carolina mining regulators have granted another extension of Piedmont Lithium's deadline to provide information about its application to build a lithium mine in northern Gaston County.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy plans gas plants as it moves away from coal, but critics ...
Preview: Three years ago, Duke Energy opened its newest natural gas-fired power plant in Asheville, on the site of an old coal-fired plant. Duke wants to build more gas plants around North Carolina as part of its plan to reduce the heat-trapping pollution that comes from electricity generation. But the idea has plenty of critics.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte council votes to slow purchases of electric buses; what ...
Preview: The Charlotte Area Transit System is tapping the brakes on plans to convert to 100% electric buses by 2030. And the slowdown is raising concerns among council members and environmentalists that Charlotte might not be able to meet the city's climate goals.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Preview: The EPA is proposing tailpipe emission rules so strict that carmakers would need two-thirds of their sales to be zero-emission by 2032 to comply. And that seems to be precisely the goal.
